website_summaries.verdict: A low-cost, quality, no-frills repair kit. Suitable for owners of the iPhone 7.
pros: Comes with 56 bits, which is more than competitors in this price range
Updated version has the Y bit for the iPhone 7
cons: No tweezers or SIM card ejector tool

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Electronics
customer_reviews.text: I first bought this to open up my PlayStation 4 so I can clean it, and I got to say that this is amazing. All of the little bits provided, helpsed me not only open my PlayStation, but my laptop, my computer and other small electronics. The variety of bits allowed me to get into lots of different shaped screws, which saved me the hassle of finding individual tools for them. The only thing missing from here that I had to purchase seperatly, was the T8 Security Screwdriver. Other than that, this thing was an awesome purchase and I will highly recommend it to anyone dealing with electronics.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Laptop Upgrades
customer_reviews.text: Was working on upgrading my old HP 15-g013dx laptop from 2015 and needed the right tools to get into the heart of the beast. If you know anything about this HP line, you have to get all the way through the machine in order to access and replace the old RAM card. What great design, right? Anywho, this driver kit was everything (and more) I needed to work through all the screws in my machine, and the magnetic drivers are pretty good at keeping the screws from dropping in unwanted places. I don't have any complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Sean M.

customer_reviews.title: Very average and some small durability issues
customer_reviews.text: Edit: the customer support was quick and easy to work with. They got me a better replacement set free of charge! Ok so here is where I stand after using things for a while. Some of the heads suck. They snap and break easily, but they get the job done. The carrying case is a mild joke to be honest. The way the screw holders are set up is kinda sloppy, but it works. Will these win an award for quality? No. Are these a good deal? Yes of course. Just know you’re sacrificing a few things for that cheaper price.
customer_reviews.author: Harley B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool kit for craftsmen
customer_reviews.text: I often find myself engaging in projects that I lack the right tool(s) for. This tool set is excellent and portable for any special needs project. I have read other reviews stating many negative reasons not buy this but, I do not believe that they knew exactly what this kit is meant for. The whole set is durable, well designed, and meets those special needs, as mentioned, and I have nothing else to add. Those who follow my reviews will know that I am straightforward with my comments, positive or negative. If you want honest and accurate reviews you can follow mine with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Rought Investigative Services

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I repair computers, phones and just about anything else. Over the years, i have purchased many sets like this and find this set to be very handy to have around. Covers most if the bits you would need but does lack some for phones. If you are looking for a good set that will meet 90% of your precision needs for less than $15, this is it. For phone repairs, i would recommend the ifixit kit. At $60, it's pricey but also comes with the pry tools.
customer_reviews.author: MADPokerKing

customer_reviews.title: Neato
customer_reviews.text: Each bit has its name engraved or lasered so thats nice. They seem to be nice high quality bits, after gentle use they still have their shape without much chipping. The magnet that attaches the bit to the screwdriver is nice and just about strong I didn't get to use the flexible bit extender So in the pictures you can see hwo the bits are nicely organized in plastic racks. Only improvement there would be if the racks were made of sturdier plastic for a more permanent means of storage. Pretty good deal, phillips are separated from japanese industry screws so that's helpful too
customer_reviews.author: Ampersand

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and durability
customer_reviews.text: The quality and durability of the bits are terrible. The tip of the 1.2 star bit completely sheared off and twisted the rest of the star grooves. This was on my first time using the set while cleaning the fans on my MacBook Pro. Luckily it was while putting the last screw back in. But this could have easily stripped the screw as well. I will now have to pick up a new set locally to tighten the screws since it sheared off when I was only tightening the screws until I felt initial resistance.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Not magnetized! but the company handled this issue very quickly!
customer_reviews.text: I recently realized these are not magnetized! Screws never stay with bits! They contacted me after several month later when I reviewed it and suggested to refund it, which I even did not know it could. But they did it. It made me believe that my unit was one of bad units and other might meet their description. Al least there is no risk for us to purchase it as they will handle the issue so quickly!
customer_reviews.author: StayHome!!!!

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for almost every need
customer_reviews.text: I got this at a white elephant for Christmas a few years back and am only posting this review because I'm so thankful to have this set. Pretty much every random need I've ever had from a screwdriver is covered by this set, including all electronics and taking apart my PS4 (t8, t9, t10 bits). The bits don't go that large in size so you might need 1 other phillips head and flat head screwdriver, other than that I feel like this one little box has me completely covered so I got rid of the rest I had.
customer_reviews.author: Allison A. Cassels

customer_reviews.title: Quality driver, some quality compromises elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small but tool kit to use for electronics projects but didn’t want to spend too much on it. I hoped this would be a good compromise and so far it seems that way. Pros: all bits are labeled on the bit and on the bit holders. Extension bar is handy for getting deep into boards obsured by chassis. Driver has swivel butt and soft rubber grips for easy turning. Cons: inner case liner is very thin, think cheap welded plastic retail packaging. Case latch opens easy but doesn’t shut without having to fiddle with it. Extra bits don’t have a home and are loose inside the top.
customer_reviews.author: Gman

customer_reviews.title: Essential Toolset for Today's Electronics
customer_reviews.text: You need this if you want to be able to open any consumer electronics item made from 1995 on. (Heck, my purchase application was 1986 Ford Bronco EEC, and I've already needed to use it on mobile phone and 2004 GMC stereo.) Driver is a bit small for my hand, and one should not expect to go > about 20 # torque with it. (But the drivers are what you need, and kit includes what you need to put bits into 1/4' ratchet wrench.) Price dramatically-exceeded expectations, handling and delivery met them.
customer_reviews.author: Slope-Shouldered Farm Boy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for opening up my old MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: I have a MacBook Pro that I received from my parents Christmas 2012, it was slow but between my work computer, iPad, and iPhone, I wasn’t running out to buy a new computer for my occasional personal use. I bought some memory to upgrade from 4gb to 8gb and this set was just what I needed to open it up! It has a large variety of sizes and shapes! Easy to use! The set is a great value with a good hard plastic case to keep it organized.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda L.

customer_reviews.title: I love this handy little set
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this tool set twice, once for myself and once for my mom. I used the set to take apart Chromebooks and laptops at work to fix screens and reassemble them. There's pretty much any size you could need, and the screwdriver fits comfortably in my hand. The triangle plastic piece works brilliantly to pry apart plastic pieces.
customer_reviews.author: living_aLOUD (Sara)

customer_reviews.title: Stripped 3 bits Fixing 2 Laptops
customer_reviews.text: The bits are made from cheap steel. Light duty, fixing my Macbook Pro and taking apart my Thinkpad T420 stripped every bit I used. What an absolute joke of a tool kit. Looks cool on the surface, something that should cost way more for what you get. I now know why. It is astounding how cheap these screws are. Please beware and spend a few extra dollars for a better set.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Very nice driver set for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for multiple reasons ranging from 3D Printing to cellphone repair. This kit has everything I need and more. Only downside I see is the case. It's a little cheap feeling but I'm fine with it. The driver, extension and bits are great. I love that each bit is also engraved with its size to make sure everything goes back in its marked slot in the bit holders.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M.

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not great.
customer_reviews.text: I think this set is a nice little set for once in a while projects. Which is what I used it for, occasional electronics work and speciality screws. There's cool extra features like the extension and flexible shaft. Unfortunately, the quality of metal in the driver bits isn't that good and I've broken or bent a few over its lifetime. It does it's job, but it's not going to last that long with heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: I use this every day
customer_reviews.text: I work with electronics from many different manufacturers and this has all the weird little bits I need. It stands up to daily use. The bits in little rubber sleeves is nice so you can put the ones you need at the moment all together. I love the extendable piece and the flex attachment. Have ordered more and given them to coworkers as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Momof3

customer_reviews.title: Gives me all the bits I need for all my devices
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after discovering that my 2017 and 2018 MacBook Pro laptops use a new screw head for which I didn't have a screw driver. This set has it all and has simplified repairs and general maintenance. Looks very well made and fits my hand well. The selection of bits is very complete. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: PB in Jersey

customer_reviews.title: A good choice for professionals
customer_reviews.text: I like the fatter screw driver handle as I have large hands, however the color is less than professional it DOES make it easy to find in the office. In terms of what it comes with this kit is a good solid option for working on computers, dvd players etc. I do tech for living and always have one of these kits available as a stand by option for general use
customer_reviews.author: martok

customer_reviews.title: Tool stripped.
customer_reviews.text: The tool kit looks awesome with a wide array of everything you would need to take a macbook apart. Until it's actually used. The metal is so soft if there is any...ANY resistance on the screw at all the bit tip strips. I really just needed it for the one bit to take off the pentalobe screws on the macbook. It's really just a fancy case with many useless parts. The driver seems nice... i think. Don't waste money on it.
customer_reviews.author: eg

customer_reviews.title: Love the magnetic heads and packaging
customer_reviews.text: This set is awesome. I will never use all the heads that come with it but the price was right for repairing my computer at home. The magnetic feature was just what I needed. Worked like a champ. This set is expertly packed into a sturdy case that stores easily because of its size. I couldn't be more satisfied with a different product.
customer_reviews.author: White Lotus Jan

customer_reviews.title: This has already come in handy twice!
customer_reviews.text: I used this first to fix my surface laptop which had a really obscure t3 bit, and then the next week i used it to fix my xbox one elite controller broken bumpers which had a (less obscure but still rare) t8. Overall, very happy, it has already more than paid for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Check'M

customer_reviews.title: Nice set
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice set with tons and tons of bits of every shape and size. It's not something I'd use if I were a professional who used these tools for a living, but for a hobbyist (I use these mostly to take apart pocket knives) they work great. If I had to be critical, I don't like that the bits aren't magnetic and they don't seat perfectly centered. But for the money and the number of bits, this is a really great set and option.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Klein

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy to open Macs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set to open a MacBook Pro 15" Mid-2015, but the Pentalobe 1.2 was too small for the screws, with not enough grip and the 1.5 was too large to fit properly, not enough grip again. None of the other sets helped.
customer_reviews.author: Halex Productions Inc

customer_reviews.title: Good but inconvenient storage
customer_reviews.text: The product works, but the packaging is very inconvenient. It uses rubber to hold the bits, so its hard to take out. When I need multiple types of bits, I either have to take them all out or struggle to pull them out in the middle of the process. Other than that, it does what's it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine H.

customer_reviews.title: Does the work well
customer_reviews.text: Successfully repaired my MacBook Pro with this toolkit. I think people that complain about the bits metal hardness are pushing too hard on it. Dunno, seems completely fine to me. Magnet could be stronger. Actually the flexible extension cord has a perfect magnet power but the main driver magnet is quite weak.
customer_reviews.author: Sega

customer_reviews.title: Mandatory
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a few months ago for replacing motherboards in laptops. This set comes with more than what you need. Over time I've run into weird screws for other jobs and this provided what is necessary. Compact and orderly if you can't tell from the box. Mandatory for IT personnel.
customer_reviews.author: MENOZE

customer_reviews.title: Makes me feel like an engineer
customer_reviews.text: Quite simply, these tools are awesome and fun to use! I am not mechanically inclined, but felt like a fool going to Apple to replace a battery for my macbook. I bought these tools, as the tools that came with the battery were made of liquid garbage. these tools arrived, the bits are labeled so if one is too big, you know which bit to try next, and they're magnetic, which is amazingly important, when dealing with these miniscule screws. I would've paid double for these, they're great.
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell Troy

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to have!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it, works great for so many kids toys. I have big hands and this screwdriver makes removing the little screws out so much easier than the typical precision screwdriver sets. The magnetic tip is nice for starting screws too!
customer_reviews.author: Michigan reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Vastar Screw Driver Set.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item, I do lots of desktop computers & Laptop repairs, with all the small and sometimes tiny screws this set came in very handy with a large variety of different bits and removal clips. Happy I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kingsbury

customer_reviews.title: You'll use it more than you think.
customer_reviews.text: An essential for anyone who works on smallish things, from electronics to models, to you name it. It has most of the common bits you'll ever need in a nice case to organize everything. Inexpensive enough to buy multiple and keep them where you use them the most.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Anywhere jobs handled
customer_reviews.text: These magnetic all size mini screwdrivers kit is perfect for that child's toy, glasses & larger jobs. With the magnet no worries about losing screws. This was the perfect gift for my sons who are on the go... no need to rummage a large tool box for a screwdriver. I would buy again and recommend this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Helm

customer_reviews.title: Great tools!
customer_reviews.text: Great tools! More than enough pieces for any job. The case the tools come in is not the best. It’s a basic over the seas cheap case and the pieces are laid in. The cover on mine did come lifted so in the event I move it around too much something may fall out. Overall great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Xander T.

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: So far, this set has had every obscure little tool that I have needed. It is not my first choice in my tool kit, but it is the go-to when I might need something different. It has never failed me yet.
customer_reviews.author: William M. Mullins

customer_reviews.title: don't get these
customer_reviews.text: What I got was very different from the picture - instead of that hard plastic shell, it came in a fake leather pouch, and everything inside seemed very filmsy and weak. I was not able to unscrew a screw from the watch bracelet - had to take it to a watchmaker.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Stripped head on first use
customer_reviews.text: I needed these to replace the battery in my Macbook. 2 Phillips heads stripped during the project, but at least didn't damage the screws.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great addition for your tool selection!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice little kit. I needed something with small bits to tighten screws on the earpieces for my glasses. This kit however can do so much more. I've used it for many things and it's a very nice addition to my tools.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Junkie!

customer_reviews.title: A must-have!
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for your household. I’ve already used it several times to repair small electronics and eyeglasses. Tons of different bit sizes and types - chances are there’s one for most all applications
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Langer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, I use it every day
customer_reviews.text: I read a few reviews for the bit on the macbook, cannot attest to that, but O have had 4 of these kits. I keep buying more because I lose the bits that I need, my bad. This kit is everything and more that I need it to be. I use it for work everyday on alarm system parts. I also have used it for working on my phone, laptop, small kids toys, my coffee maker. I will buy another I'm sure and I have recommended this product to anyone that sees it and asks. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: James Riley

customer_reviews.title: Great functionality
customer_reviews.text: Solid set with a lot of options. The bendable attachment as well as the extendable handle are nice touches. Docking the star for the clear insert inside the orange case. It's made of very flimsy plastic. I'll probably 3d print a hard plastic one.
customer_reviews.author: Legendarycheez

customer_reviews.title: Driver bit for macbook pro screws is unfortunately extremely fragile
customer_reviews.text: Update: The store that sold this to me refunded the order due to the stripped bit. The bit used on the screws on the bottom case of my macbook pro was destroyed after letting the bit slip once. Thankfully I had gotten all but two screws reinstalled by the time it was useless, but it's very disappointing that the bit was so easy to destroy after just 1 use, especially when it was the primary reason for purchasing the kit.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C.

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for Price
customer_reviews.text: This kit has helped me tremendously as I like to clean and refurbish old video game consoles and accessories. It has pretty much everything I need and it's my go to kit. My only complaint which isn't much of a complaint but just something to be aware of: the clip used to open the case is kind of strange and I accidentally broke it off while first trying to open the kit. Other than that I would highly recommend this kit.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Pruitt

customer_reviews.title: After much shopping I decided on this one for its great price and variety of bits
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, I was quite shocked with the outstanding quality of this product. I bought this to modify an Xbox controller which reqired a T8 security bit. After much shopping I decided on this one for its great price and variety of bits. From the picture I expected something in a flimsy box with low quality metal bits, but it is exactly the opposite. This little tool has everything to open and fix almost any electronic device. Overall, I'm very happy with my purchase and I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto

customer_reviews.title: Pretty solid for a cheap electronic repair set
customer_reviews.text: Everything you need. Wish it had a suction cup like other electronic repair kits. Haven’t experienced any bent or broken bits yet with several small repairs in. The case internal organization is kind of cheap but what do you expect? The bit driver and extensions are all solid, the bits are snug and magnetized, the bonus bits are loose in the top but you’ll need them if you’re working on iPhones. I’d buy again.
customer_reviews.author: William mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Ecellent toolset for mobile phones, laptops and small electronics
customer_reviews.text: Ordered in 2016. All the bits are still in very good shape and nothing broke. All you need to open mible phones, laptops (WinPCs and Macbooks).
customer_reviews.author: Tech Walker

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: the screwdriver is good and fits in varies use. just the pad for each bits will be easily in a mess when you pulls a bits out from the pad.
customer_reviews.author: Synch Chen

customer_reviews.title: Great toolset wide variety of bits
customer_reviews.text: I needed a T9, T10 for one project. I needed a T5 for another project this kit has all sizes I needed. Very nicely packaged. I have an IPAD that needs work anbd hope this that the tools I need for that project too.
customer_reviews.author: RHdk

customer_reviews.title: Best small driver with bits for a budget.
customer_reviews.text: Best kit out there. Only wish the inside that holds everything was better than super thin plastic. I'd have paid more for a different way to be stored in the case and organized. It works. I got it to fix a few Xbox one controllers and worked great.
customer_reviews.author: TroutProf

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool kit
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect much for the price point, but was pleasantly surprised. I've used a number of the smaller bits for working on small electronics and they held up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Robert L. King

customer_reviews.title: Jack of all trades
customer_reviews.text: This can get you into just about any small electronic device. i been into 4-5 laptops already and a cell phone. Awesome collection of small bits. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Spoot

customer_reviews.title: Every bit you need
customer_reviews.text: Apart from a ratcheting head, this set has virtually every screw head imaginable. The driver is magnetic and correctly sized, so while its not perfect, it can grab a dropped piece. The extension next is flexible enough to get through decently small holes to a port or buried fastener.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does not have the Y00 tripoint head to need to open the iPhone 7
customer_reviews.text: The description says it will open the iPhone 7. While this kit has lots of different types of heads, including some tripoints, it doesn't have the almost microscopic tripoint you need. So, useful for lots of things, but not that.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Carr

customer_reviews.title: a lot of bits for cheap that work for most stuff
customer_reviews.text: these worked for what i needed them for and seem to not strip easy. there is 2 extra bits they give but there is no palce for them to go really.
customer_reviews.author: james42519

customer_reviews.title: Stop browsing and BUY THIS SET
customer_reviews.text: I cant describe how helpful this set has already been. From intricite computer repair of tiny screws to average sized ones in assembling furniture. What a lifesaver and with the extension ability so convenient. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong after two years of use!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this set two years ago, and I have been using them for numerous occasions include so many iphones and macbooks. Fantastic tools!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Z

customer_reviews.title: missing and redundant bits - otherwise good and as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This electronics screwdriver set would be great for the price, except mine shipped with a redundant row 6, and no row 5. So I'm missing five bits, and I have five redundant bits. One of the missing bits I happen to need right now, Torx T5. If you order this set check all bits right away, don't be like me and wait over a year to realize someone messed up putting my set together. Too late for me to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Blecker

customer_reviews.title: Nice.  Definitely worth the buy.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I like how soft the bit cradles are so they're easy to manipulate and get into and out of the case without feeling like I'm having to smash anything. This has all the bits I need for the computer upgrades and repairs that I've been doing. July 2016 Update: Just repaired a Macbook Air with these. I did a complete disassembly and reassembly and this kit had all the tools I needed for it. Still impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Nate S.

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: The only issue I have had with is the csae brocken upon arrival. Not a deal breaker, just annoying. The tools worked great for assembling my PC and tightening some screws on eyeglasses. Good value for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Archer C Ford IV

customer_reviews.title: Great tool set
customer_reviews.text: Have been using for awhile and works Great when using on computers and other peripheral equipment.
customer_reviews.author: zeker

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good kit. I use it for everything from opening up my ps4 controller to installing a rear view camera to my car to messing around in my pc. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: NYC^^^1

customer_reviews.title: low cost, great quality, great utility
customer_reviews.text: This is the only "precision" screwdriver set I've purchased, and it's drivers has served every situation without fail
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: this is probably one of my favorite purchases of the year
customer_reviews.text: I don't make enough reviews of things I buy on amazon, but I have to say, this is probably one of my favorite purchases of the year. Very high quality and just what I needed for my tinkering needs. I bought this when it was on say for $20 which to me is a steal. With this, the first thing I did was open up a mid-2010 macbook to finally take out the faulty battery inside of it (which had expanded and caused damage to the trackpad). This tool set had just the right bit to take out the Y-type screw. Would highly recommend, even more so when it's on sale. you can't go wrong with this.
customer_reviews.author: jack tallman

customer_reviews.title: A lot for the price.
customer_reviews.text: A lot of different heads / options for the price and I like the magnetic feature, but in my first try with one of the smallest phillips the head got bended and now is useless, perhaps the fastener was to tight and that happens maybe it was my fault, I wish it could have been made out stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Momo

customer_reviews.title: Not magnetized as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The main reason I bought this set was because they advertised it to be magnetic. I had a small sunglasses screw that wouldn't stay on the driver and bit. Very disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A. Butera

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST and ONLY tool set I need
customer_reviews.text: Has exactly what I needed and much better built materials than I ever could have expected. The case is great as well just don't throw it down hard it is plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Low quality, for looks
customer_reviews.text: Unlikely to be useful, poorly realized designs. Looks good in pictures but it is all low spec chromed dipped bits that won't do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: Great assortment of small screw and hex bolt drivers. Really compact and easy to store. Very useful for any small handy work you might have.
customer_reviews.author: John G.

customer_reviews.title: Really good set
customer_reviews.text: This screwdriver set allows me to work on all devices from basic pcs to MacBooks. It is nice having a high-quality set of screwdrivers.
customer_reviews.author: Denis Cole

customer_reviews.title: Weak
customer_reviews.text: The material of the bits is soft and wears off quickly, you get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.author: Top Coffee Bender

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: My set is fine but my firends set got striped when he used it on the wrong screw. Metal could be stronger but overall really handy and useful
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: The t sizes fit my knives and I dont know how many times I needed the tiny phillips screawdriver bit. Irreplaceable. So well needed and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: AKirby43

customer_reviews.title: Pretty impressed for the price
customer_reviews.text: The tools themselves work perfectly for electronics and minor repairs. On the other hand the packaging was horrible and everything is held by a thin piece of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: James Matthew Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Nice bits and driver, bad case.
customer_reviews.text: For the price it's great, go for it, but just know the inside of the case holding everything in place is the thin plastic wrapping. The kind of thin plastic you'd see holding a hot wheels car onto the cardboard backing.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great PC tool kit
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool kit that has all the bits I ever need when working on various laptops and desktops. Doesn't seem cheap at all, other than the clear plastic insert that holds everything.
customer_reviews.author: T. Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Wide variety of tools!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this set for repairing my MacBook Pro. This has everything needed for my repair. The tool set is a great quality for the price, I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Familia Camacho

customer_reviews.title: Seems to cover everything for small electronics. I'm not an expert.
customer_reviews.text: I don't even know what else I would need for little electronic projects. This little kit has sorted my out every time so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Caswell

customer_reviews.title: Good Tools - Somewhat cheap case (good rubber holdings though)
customer_reviews.text: I’d like the case to be molded for the pieces instead of using a cheap plastic mold to hold them in place. Other than that, the tools and pieces are sturdy and strong enough for most tasks. Just don’t put too much stress on them as you’ll get what you paid for. I would still recommend these tools exactly for what they were advertised for.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Belliston

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Got this for grandson’s 11th Birthday to help build a gaming PC - worked well
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has always needed a five point tork and we could never find one. This set has every tip you could ever need and then some! Also has cool attachments for hard to reach tight spaces! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: Nice price. Sturdy enough for what you should be using these on. Happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper 01

customer_reviews.title: Very nice set
customer_reviews.text: Very nice set of precision tools for working with small electronics. A very good set of bits and bit sizes.
customer_reviews.author: JustJoe

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice to Have
customer_reviews.text: Don't use these tools very often but when you need one they are great to have around the house
customer_reviews.author: R. Webster

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I was having trouble finding the right tools to open old hard drives to physically remove the plates before recycling. I didn't realize how many different precision drivers were needed. This toolkit had all of them and was easy to use. The package also arrive on time and in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Artiesdad

customer_reviews.title: Blown
customer_reviews.text: Mind blowing set. Good quality and has almost everything we need for regular usage. Only thing I didn't like is inside there is a separate thin plastic thing on which everything is placed. I have used other sets which has solid placement stands inside box connected to the surface. There is a photo describing that.
customer_reviews.author: Shivam H.

customer_reviews.title: CLUTCH TO THE MAX
customer_reviews.text: THIS KIT IS SO USEFUL AND YOU CAN'T BEAT THE PRICE....BUY BUY BUY
customer_reviews.author: Zakary Rankin Howard

customer_reviews.title: Great set; fragile latch.
customer_reviews.text: The set itself is great and works just fine. The case it's in, however, seems to be fragile. The latch that holds the plastic topper on broke off within my first day of use. Not a deal breaker, but a bit annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony W

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need for small electronics repair
customer_reviews.text: This little guy has all the stuff you need for simple small electronics repair and disassembly. It works great so far..
customer_reviews.author: stuff buyer

customer_reviews.title: Super nice most functional kit I have in my whole toolbox
customer_reviews.text: This has been my go to screwdriver kit I love it
customer_reviews.author: Duskydog26

customer_reviews.title: Helped me get into MacBook Pro (2014)
customer_reviews.text: This item perfectly helped me get in to dust my MacBook. The magnetic bits were extremely useful when doing such. It appears I'll be able to do many other things with my other electronics in the future as well. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Have not used this extensively, but seems to be reasonable well made, especially for the low price.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: The perfect versatility tool for IT Technicians!
customer_reviews.text: I've actually bought two of these. My old workcenter has my other one (I gave it to them). These are great for work, and the tips are magnetic (major selling point), so be careful when using these around hard drives! Overall, I couldn't ask for a better product.
customer_reviews.author: OkiBoy17

customer_reviews.title: You probably want to buy something else.
customer_reviews.text: There are lots of options but that’s where the good news ends, sadly my T7 bit is actually a 1.5 flathead. Also the tips easily break because they are a low grade metal. The handle only made it through a couple projects before that was junk too.
customer_reviews.author: Godelt

customer_reviews.title: Great set
customer_reviews.text: Love this set. Easy to use and great for many different tasks
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great selection of bits
customer_reviews.text: It has every bit most people would ever need for electronics. Does the job
customer_reviews.author: Simple guy who hates crap products

customer_reviews.title: I love this toolkit
customer_reviews.text: I love this toolkit! I have purchased a few toolkits including the ifixit toolkit but this one rocks! The main tool is my asolute favorite of all the sets I have purchased to date and that is the reason for the five star rating. It's not bulky and works great with any project. I use it daily at work and at home.
customer_reviews.author: M. Knight

customer_reviews.title: Great for the "fix it" handy man.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tool set. It has just about every little "bit" you might need. I teach science and seem to always be elbow deep in fixing something. Whether it's a mechanical balance, a computer hard drive replacement or the handle on a cabinet, this kit has it all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: "Best Gift Ever" - HIs words, not mine.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a surprise gift for my favorite I.T guy and he described it as "the best gift ever". It has all the pieces as described, exactly as in the pictures, compact and handy. It can be used in all sorts of devices, all the way from TV and computer cases to cellphones. Great quality, great price. Would totally buy again... If this one ever breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Marian

customer_reviews.title: very useful with wonderful features
customer_reviews.text: the hidden extension bar is a nice feature along with the adapter to use a regular 1/4" drive screwdriver with was a nice surprise. its made of decent materials and seems sturdy and strong. Opened my iphone 7plus with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas medina

customer_reviews.title: affordable
customer_reviews.text: doesn't last beyond light use, but most of these won't see much heavy use anyway
customer_reviews.author: Arne

customer_reviews.title: Very good. Used this set to take apart a Nintendo ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good. Used this set to take apart a Nintendo 3DS, and now I have the tools needed for other work requiring small and oddly shaped screwdrivers. Quality of the metal was good enough that it did not strip the screw or damage the driver when I was using it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Estill

product_meta.title: Vastar 62 in 1 with 56 Bit Magnetic Driver Kit, Precision Screwdriver Set Smartphone Repair Tool Kit for iPhone 8/8 Plus,7/7 Plus and other Cell Phone, Tablet, PC, Macbook,Clock, Game Console and More
feature_bullets: 56 bits well selected by Vastar to repair modern electronics that serve various popular laptops, phones, game consoles and other electronics
The smart phone repair kit, updated with 1x long plastic pry openers and 1x triangle pry openers, Tri-Wing 0.8 and CRV Torx 1.5, works for iPhone 8, 8 Plus, iPhone 7, 7 Plus and other cell phones
Easy portability- professional portable hardware tools with perfect weight & compact design
The Unique non slip driver in the market is machined from a single piece of aluminum, and cover with the Silica gel, it also with a ball bearing mounted swivel top to make the work more easily
The flexible shaft is great for stereo work or other large electronics where all the screws are not on the surface
